ygData.subject: Re: Fiery Avenger really that good?
ygData.msgSnippet: Please note, double attack is different than dual wield.  Double attack will allow 2 attacks with same weapon in that same round .  While dual wield would be
ygData.messageBody:
Please note, double attack is different than dual wield. Double attack will
allow 2 attacks with same weapon in that same "round". While dual wield
would be 2 weapons, blah blah blah... total of 4 attacks occasionally.

But you are right, the theory would have to be adjusted a little. So say
the Avenger does 100pts of damage... double attack would allow 200pts in a
"round". It still doesn't seem to add up. Of course, it has that spell
effect too, which might make all the difference in the world. Against
non-monks anyway. The problem with fighting a monk isn't doing damage, it's
hitting the slippery devils in the first place. I REALLY wouldn't want to
find a creature with a delay 50 weapon if I only hit them in 1 out of 8
attempts. (and spell-weapons can only go off if you score a hit)

-Kzak

-----Original Message-----
From: Tim West [mailto:twest@...]
Sent: Monday, June 28, 1999 1:15 PM
To: EQCheats@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQCheats] Fiery Avenger really that good?


From: "Tim West" <twest@...>



Ah, yes. Paladins do get Double attack at Lev 20. This would help a lot
and ruin a little bit of your theory.

Tanaman
